c74object.name: j.namespace
c74object.description: j.namespace is a utility to perform advanced Jamoma namespace queries and filtering. It is useful to manage and navigate through the various addresses nodes of your Jamoma Max patch, for example when building GUI interface

outlet.description: j.namespace leftmost outlet outputs the nodes addresses matching the filter appied on the namespace selection. Addresses may be output as a single list or as preformatted messages for some Max GUI objects, as defined by the format attribute
j.namespace middle outlet outputs the size of the filter result that is, the number of matching nodes addresses
Dump out values of the various j.namespace attribute

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The address attribute sets the root of the nodes addresses set the exploration will be performed on. The address may be any node in the namespace, such as the root (/) of the Jamoma namespace (default), a model address or a parameter address for example.

attribute.name: depth
attribute.description: The depth attribute sets the recursive depth used for the exploration. A depth of 1 will perform the exploration only on the first node under the root defined by the address attribute. A depth of -1 (default) will perform the exploration on all nodes under the root.

attribute.name: filter/list
attribute.digest: Set the type of addresses to filter
attribute.description:
The filter/list attribute sets the type of addresses set to perform filtering on. Possible values are:
model
parameter
message
return
view
remote

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format attribute defines how results from the exploration filter will be formatted and output

enum.name: none
enum.digest: Results will be output as a list
enum.description: Results will be output as a list

enum.name: umenu
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu
enum.description: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu

enum.name: umenu_prefix
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu with root added as prefix
enum.description: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu with root added as prefix

enum.name: jit.cellblock
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a jit.cellblock
enum.description: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a jit.cellblock

enum.name: coll
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a coll
enum.description: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a coll

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: The namespace attribute sets a name to this instance of j.namespace. This is required when using j.namespace to perform exploration in combination with other Jamoma object such as j.cue

attribute.name: sort
attribute.digest: Sort result in alphabetical or priority order
attribute.description: The sort attribute gets results from exploration filter sorted alphabetically (default) or based on their priority value

attribute.name: update
attribute.digest: Listen to updates in Jamoma namespace
attribute.description: The update attribute lets you disable the listening of nodes creation/deletion in Jamoma namespace. When set to off, j.namespace will stop outputing results as changes occur in the namespace. In that case, one must send again the address attribute in order to refresh the namespace exploration result. (default : 1)
